channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Massive 149 Million Credential Leak Exposes Gmail, Facebook, and Financial Service Users
item.description:
A publicly accessible, unencrypted 96 GB database containing 149.4 million unique login credentials has been discovered by a security researcher. The data, believed to be compiled from various infostealer malware logs and past breaches, impacts an estimated 48 million Gmail accounts, alongside users...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Nike Probes Data Breach Claim by 'WorldLeaks' Extortion Group
item.description:
Global apparel giant Nike has launched an investigation into a potential data breach after being listed as a victim by the 'WorldLeaks' data extortion group. The group, which emerged in 2025 and focuses on data theft without deploying ransomware, threatened to publish stolen Nike data on January 24....

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Sandworm Deploys New 'DynoWiper' Malware in Failed Attack on Polish Power Grid
item.description:
The Russian state-sponsored hacking group Sandworm has been attributed with a major, albeit unsuccessful, cyberattack against Poland's power system in late December 2025. Poland's energy minister described it as the 'largest cyber attack' on their energy infrastructure in years. Cybersecurity firm E...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Actor, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Phishing Campaign Hits Russia with Amnesia RAT, Uses GitHub and Dropbox for Payload Delivery
item.description:
A sophisticated, multi-stage phishing campaign is targeting users in Russia, delivering a combination of the Amnesia remote access trojan (RAT) and ransomware. The attack, analyzed by Fortinet FortiGuard Labs, is notable for its use of public cloud services like GitHub and Dropbox to host payloads a...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks
item.description:
The notorious cyber extortion syndicate ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for breaching business intelligence firm Crunchbase and financial advisory company Betterment. According to the threat actor, the initial access was gained by using sophisticated voice phishing (vishing) attacks to socia...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Group Leaks 343GB of Under Armour Customer Data
item.description:
The Russia-linked Everest ransomware group has leaked 343 GB of data allegedly stolen from global sportswear brand Under Armour. The massive data dump, which occurred on January 24, 2026, followed a failed extortion attempt. The leaked data is reported to contain the personally identifiable informat...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Warning: Fully Patched FortiGate Firewalls Are Being Compromised via New SSO Bypass
item.description:
Security analysts are warning of a new wave of attacks compromising even fully patched Fortinet FortiGate firewalls. The activity, observed since January 15, 2026, allows attackers to bypass SAML-based single sign-on (SSO) authentication to gain administrative access. The attacks result in unauthori...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Trend Micro Details New RCE Flaw in MetaGPT (CVE-2026-0761)
item.description:
Trend Micro has published details and a detection rule for a new high-severity remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Foundation Agents MetaGPT, tracked as CVE-2026-0761. The exploit, which occurs over HTTP, can be leveraged by an attacker for initial access into a network or for lateral movem...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Pwn2Own Automotive: Hackers Earn $1M+ Exposing 76 Zero-Days in Tesla and Other Vehicle Systems
item.description:
At the Pwn2Own Automotive 2026 event, security researchers earned over $1 million by successfully demonstrating 76 unique zero-day exploits against a range of modern vehicle systems. A major focus was Tesla, where researchers chained multiple vulnerabilities to gain root access to an infotainment sy...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: LastPass Users Targeted in Phishing Campaign to Steal Master Passwords
item.description:
Password manager service LastPass is warning its users of an active phishing campaign aimed at stealing their master passwords. Attackers are sending fraudulent emails that impersonate official LastPass maintenance alerts, creating a false sense of urgency to trick users into 'backing up' their pass...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: DragonForce Ransomware Claims Attack on U.S. Bank, Threatens Data Leak
item.description:
The DragonForce ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Uinta Bank, a community bank based in Wyoming, USA. In a post on their data leak site on January 23, 2026, the threat actors announced the breach and threatened to publish a "full dump" of the bank's data if negoti...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft Issues Emergency Out-of-Band Patches for Flawed January Updates
item.description:
Microsoft has released several emergency out-of-band (OOB) updates on January 24, 2026, to address significant bugs introduced by its January 13 Patch Tuesday release. The faulty updates caused a range of issues, including Remote Desktop connection failures, application hangs when accessing cloud st...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: UK Advances New Bill to Regulate Managed Service Providers (MSPs)
item.description:
The United Kingdom government is advancing a new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill aimed at strengthening the nation's digital supply chain. A key provision of the bill is to bring Managed Service Providers (MSPs) under direct regulatory oversight for the first time. Citing the systemic risk demons...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Mandates Patching for Four Actively Exploited Flaws in Zimbra, Vite, and More
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added four vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, confirming they are under active attack. The flaws affect a diverse range of products, including Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (CVE-2025-68645), ...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: North Korean Hackers Lure Developers with Fake Job Interviews, Backdoor macOS via VS Code
item.description:
State-sponsored threat actors from North Korea, including the Lazarus Group, are targeting software developers in a sophisticated campaign dubbed 'Contagious Interview.' According to Jamf Threat Labs, the attackers use fake job offers to entice developers, particularly in the crypto and fintech sect...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: PcComponentes Denies Data Breach, Blames Credential Stuffing for Account Takeovers
item.description:
Spanish electronics retailer PcComponentes has denied claims of a massive data breach affecting 16 million customers, stating its internal systems were not compromised. The announcement came after a threat actor, 'daghetiaw,' attempted to sell a large customer database on a hacking forum. The compan...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Osiris' Ransomware Borrows TTPs from Medusa and Inc Gangs, Uses Signed Driver to Kill AV
item.description:
A new ransomware strain named Osiris is demonstrating a high level of sophistication by combining tactics from established ransomware groups like Medusa and Inc. The attackers use Rclone for data exfiltration to Wasabi cloud storage and deploy a version of Mimikatz named `kaz.exe`, both TTPs linked ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: INC Ransomware OPSEC Fail: Reused Infrastructure Leads to Data Recovery for 12 U.S. Victims
item.description:
A significant operational security (OPSEC) failure by the INC ransomware group has allowed cybersecurity firm Cyber Centaurs to recover stolen data for twelve U.S. organizations. The discovery was made after analyzing an attack involving the RainINC ransomware variant. Researchers found artifacts fr...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Incident Response, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Anubis RaaS Ups the Ante with Destructive 'Wipe Mode' to Maximize Extortion
item.description:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named Anubis is gaining attention for its destructive capabilities. Evolving from a prototype called 'Sphinx,' Anubis offers its affiliates a dual-execution model. In addition to standard encryption, the malware can be run with a `/WIPEMODE` parameter t...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →
